intro: Galium sosnowskyi, commonly known as Sosnowsky's wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
